reviews.review_msg: Dr. Bains provided extra help and encouragement to my friends and I during the semester (finally, a teacher with heart).  He made complex concepts simpler to understand.  I believe he should be the one teaching courses full time rather than being a TA.  On a side note, he loves his hockey!
Thank god Onkar was TAing the course.  He is the best TA EVER!  Without him I would be so lost.

There's an extremely long list of adjectives I can use to describe Dr. Bains...AMAZING, INCREDIBLE, AWESOME, think that should about do it. But seriously, he's the best. Had him as a TA in MBB 222 and he's th eonly reason the class was bearable. Always willing to help, crystal clear, super easy to talk to. Just an overall super nice guy!!!

All of the answers to his tests come from his notes! He is approachable and the grading scheme is very fair. Anyone who did bad in his class has them-self to blame for it. His notes are clear and he explains topics well.I would take his class again because most of the students are whining and getting worse grades giving you a better opportunity
Good lecturer, asks mostly fair questions with a couple tricky ones. Exam/midterms are short so if you make very little mistakes, you'll still end up losing a big chunk of marks.

He is a good person, but not a good prof. He literally spent the last two weeks rushing the material. We literally did 3 lectures in 50min time -- he sped through it SO fast. He exams are hard and picks on tiny details....

He is trying his best, but still, the exams aren't really fair. He tend to pick the tiny parts of his notes to put on exams. Also he taught 50% of material in first 9/10 semester and taught another 50% on the last few days. usually notes are 15-20 pages while the Last notes he spend 2 days on was 47 pages.takes forever to study,fail if ur not smart

midterms are straight from his notes. goes slowly through the material so everyone understands but speeds up a month before the final and does 3 lectures in one class. lectures are usually extremely dull and seem like they last forever. nice guy though and always willing to help. also witty.
Exams are focused on details, not the big picture. Lots of memorization.

Completely useless. I went to talk to Briscoe after class and he completely brushed me off, didn't even answer my question. The test was ridiculous, not based on notes, and he wasted a lot of lecture time. Worst professor I've ever had at SFU.

Excellent Prof. Dont buy the txt, he only tests on notes. He teaches by analogy, giving examples of well known events and how they relate to MBB. He gives ample time for finals and midterms, they border on too short. A very fair marker, if you meet with him he can perfectly explain why you lost marks. Downside: He marks spelling, so know ur stuff.

The final was RIDICULOUS. The prof tested on minute details from the course (there was an 8 mark question on introns, which we spent about 5 minutes covering in class). I went into the test with a 90% in the course, I'll be amazed if I get anything above 60% on the final.

Not using a textbook makes it way easier to study for exams...just read the notes! His lectures were always interesting . His pre-exam hotline and some of his jokes are a little awkward but, putting all that aside, he's actually really good. Easy tutorials, decently easy problem sets, and fair midterms. Study the notes! BIG TIME

Since there is absolutely no use for the very expensive textbook, he shouldn't even put it as a required text on the course outline. Students are as broke as it can be, so why make us spend 100s of dollars on an absolute piece of useless thing, when the notes are sufficient. I don't get it
Avoid him if u can.Exams are not fair.Easy MT, Very hard final, no scale.TUT and problem sets are not relevant to exams. Make sure fully understand his notes.
Does not use textbook but won't tell you at the beginning of the course. What a waste of money. No scaling, GPA killer. Avoid.

the marking is unfair and he is never available for extra help. he tries to trick you on exams and instead of focusing on major concepts he asks you questions about tiny little details which aren't even important. he doesn't even scale the class. try to avoid him!

Absolute jerk. He is all nice and open like "come see me in office hours" but nearly impossible to get an appt. with. He was really rude in person and his test style was asking alot. Do yourself a favor...take with a different prof. There is a reason he's a sessional.

Only prof I've ever met that has an "exam hot-line" that goes until 11pm the night before the exam! It's pretty nice of him to sit in his office listening to our calls before every exam. Marking for assignments in particular are really specific and tough though. Questions were very welcomed and he was never condescending from what I experienced.

Lectures are worth attending as he's a great speaker. Notes are provided and studying from them alone got me a good grade. Assignment marking is quite strict and the exams are all MC which can become very tedious and tricky, but it's completely manageable! He was really nice to the students in his office when I went, so overall... good prof =)

Hey.. give him a little break. Of course the material was overwhelming and the exams were hard, it's not totally his fault. I just don't get why people say that the lectures were unrelated to the exam, because they are. I only studied his notes and got A. And, at least for me, I've never seen him showing disrespect toward students.

The course has lots of material, but it's all in the textbook. I'm the lazy type and I attended 5 lectures max but I read the textbook word for word and still got a good grade. His lectures are boring and pointless so don't go if you're the type who can just sit and read. His exam formats suck (All MC and variations of MC)

i love biochem and wanted to major in it. But this prof ruined everything. I worked so hard in this class, but it was all useless. I was very broken with my final grade in this class. i repeated it and got the best grade. I don't prefer him. His exams are very hard and weird. he seems helpful but is not in reality. AVOID HIM!!!
A difficult class, and a professor who is helpful-yet somewhat unfair. The exams are difficult purely because of their format. Exams (although scantron) still take 2+ weeks to grade.

This is one prof where the majority of negative student comments reflect 100% truth. He refused to use a mic, he treats students like dirt in person. His exams are unfair as they are weirdly worded. Be warned: you may have an B-B+ avg going into the final and he will give you a D overall. RIDICULOUS. AVOID!

I think some of the reviewers on here are being a bit harsh. First of all, the course itself it's pretty content-heavy, so you can't expect to get everything handed to you on a silver platter. I didn't do very well on the first midterm, but improved on my second. It's important that you really read the notes that he gives you rather than the text.

Has issues with giving the bigger picture. If you do not read the textbook you will be lost. But he doesn't want you to read the text, so go figure... Unfair grading schemes for problem sets. Generally an unstable person with some sort of a split personality disorder.

The worst prof of all my undergrad classes. Yeah, he knows what he's talking about but I think he teaches so he can hear himself talk. Tests are setup so he can tell you how stupid you are in the review session - he's NOT helpful. I liked biochem before this class, Briscoe ruined it. AVOID! Wait another term for another prof, you will be thankful.

Absolutely horrendous professor. He clearly loves the material and is okay at explaining during lecture but he is a grade A jerk in person. His exams are ludicrous, and he has no qualms about failing students. He refuses to listen to students and is rude and condescending. He called a student "stupid" in office hours. How very helpful. AVOID.

Let's put it this way, this professor is as specific with his answers as a key is that "fits" into a particular lock and in THAT lock only. He has a low tolerance for flexibility in his marking scheme and YES, he emphasises more on details that do not in any way demonstrate the students' comprehension of the course content itself.
Seems helpful enough in lecture, but tests are horrible.  Uses extremely unclear wording and multiple choice questions are very tricky.  Avoid if you want a good mark!

AVOID. Sure he knows how to do teach the lecture. Tests are his downside. Briscoe focuses his testing on your ability to follow his bizarre testing techniques with less emphasis on your comprehension of the material. Never given the full time for midterms. TA's don't help, they always respond "the prof said were not allowed to answer that".

Terrible prof, knows his stuff but shows no sympathy to students. Easy to get A or B on midterm if you work hard. But after the final everyone went down to D!! B to a D. Didn't respond to complaints. Had to get MBB head involved. Take him... to drop your GPA =)
Horrible Professor! Midterms are not that bad but the final was horrible.  Refused to scale even though the highest mark in his class was a B+, No A's.
simply, just don't take his class. NO SCALE at all, so his class will drop your GPA significantly.
Great at teaching. Makes class interesting even though the material wasn't all the time.

Best professor I've had at SFU. LECTURES: Engaging, very interesting, excellent lecturing ability. EXAMS: very fair, answers are in the notes, marks off for spelling, but w/ good reason and warns you before hand anyway. So don't know why everyone is rating him so poorly (probably b/c they got bad marks). COURSE: very material dense, but interesting

great lecturer,i looked forward to attending lectures.very helpful and kind.his midterms and final were all fair.every single question was from the notes.if you want to do good on the midterms you have to know the notes in great detail because he loves going into details of things and make really tough multiple choice questions n put them on tests

Scott's lectures are engaging and fascinating. However, his ability to create fair examinations and problem sets is the worst I've seen in my undergraduate career. To approximate a normal distribution of marks, he gives questions that cover material undisclosed in lectures, subtracts marks for silly spelling errors, and is not understanding at all.

Fairly decent prof. Seems un-approachable at first but genuinely seems to enjoy helping out students. A bit geeky in class, but otherwise very knowledgable. Notes were good. Tests were fair but some questions and marking scheme were absurd (ie: marks off for minor spelling error!) Still, I'd take him again for MBB.

One of the best profs I've had, when I attended class at least, but his notes were good and his interest level in the material was high. And he encourages class participation, so I would recomend this prof for anyone thinking of taking MBB ;)
Not a very efficient lecturer.

I think she's an excellent prof!  MBB courses definitely take a lot of work but if you pay super close attention to her in class, you don't even have to read the textbook.  Just review your notes and you'll do fine.  Very friendly and also approachable.
She can be monotone at times but she is very nice and always asks for student feedback and responds accordingly.
